content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame, col_name::String = "dt")::DataFrame
    df[!isna.(df[col_name]))] = map(yearmonth, df[col_name]]), 
    years_month = String.(yearmonth, each(row[df]) for row in eachrow(df))))
    DataFrame{Int64}(zip(years_month[:, 1]], years_month[:, 2:end]...))
end
```
This function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame `df` and an optional column name `col_name` as input. It then extracts year and month from the provided date time column, concatenates them together in format "yyyymm", and adds this new column `ym` to the original DataFrame.

Note: The function assumes that the input column contains valid date time values. If there are missing or invalid dates, you may need to add additional error checking.
